text: And Bezalel and Oholiab and everyone \add who is\add* skilled of heart in whom Yahweh has put wisdom and skill to know and to do all the work for the service of the sanctuary—\add they\add* will do \add it\add*, according to all that Yahweh has commanded.”
Making the Tabernacle
And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab and everyone skilled of heart, in whose heart Yahweh had put skill, all whose heart lifted him to come near to the work in order to do it.

And they took from Moses all the contributions\f + \fr 36:3 \ft Hebrew “contribution” \f* that the ⸤Israelites⸥\f + \fr 36:3 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f* had brought for the work of the service for the sanctuary in order to do it, and they still brought to him voluntary offerings ⸤every morning⸥.\f + \fr 36:3 \ft Literally “in the morning in the morning” \f*
And all the skilled \add workers who were\add* doing all the work for the sanctuary came, ⸤each⸥\f + \fr 36:4 \ft Literally “man man” \f* from his work that they were doing.

And they said to Moses, saying, “The people are ⸤bringing more⸥\f + \fr 36:5 \ft Literally “making much to bring” \f* than enough for the service of the work that Yahweh has commanded ⸤to be done⸥.”\f + \fr 36:5 \ft Literally “to do it” \f*

And Moses commanded, and they ⸤proclaimed the message⸥\f + \fr 36:6 \ft Literally “caused a voice to cross through” \f* in the camp, saying, “Let no man or woman again make anything for the sanctuary contribution.” And so the people were restrained from bringing.
And the material was enough for doing all the work, and it was left over.

And all who were skilled of heart among the doers of the work made the tabernacle \add with\add* ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue and purple and crimson \add yarns\add*, \add with\add* cherubim; he made them, the work of a skilled craftsman.
The length of the one curtain \add was\add* twenty-eight cubits, and the width \add was\add* four cubits \add for\add* the one curtain; one measurement \add was\add* for all the curtains.
And he joined five of the curtains ⸤one to another⸥,\f + \fr 36:10 \ft Literally “one to one” \f* and five curtains he joined ⸤one to another⸥.\f + \fr 36:10 \ft Literally “one to one” \f*
And he made loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain, at the end in the set; so he did on the edge of the end curtain in the second set.

He made fifty loops on the one curtain, and he made fifty loops on the end of the curtain that \add was\add* in the second set; the loops were opposite\f + \fr 36:12 \ft Or “interlinked” or “matching” \f* ⸤one to another⸥.\f + \fr 36:12 \ft Literally “one to one” \f*
And he made fifty gold clasps and joined the curtains ⸤one to another⸥\f + \fr 36:13 \ft Literally “one to one” \f* with the clasps, so that the tabernacle was one.
And he made curtains of goat hair for a tent over the tabernacle; he made them eleven curtains.
The length of the one curtain \add was\add* thirty cubits, and the width \add was\add* four cubits \add for\add* the one curtain; one measure \add was\add* for \add the\add* eleven curtains.
And he joined five curtains together and six curtains together.
And he made fifty loops on the edge of the end curtain in the set, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain \add in\add* the second set.
And he made fifty bronze clasps for joining the tent to become one.
And he made a covering for the tent of red-dyed ram skin and a covering of fine leather \add to go\add* above.
And he made the frames\f + \fr 36:20 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* for the tabernacle of acacia wood \add as\add* uprights.\f + \fr 36:20 \ft Literally “standing” \f*

The length of the frame\f + \fr 36:21 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f* \add was\add* ten cubits, and the width of the one frame\f + \fr 36:21 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f* \add was\add* one and a half cubits.

He made two ⸤pegs⸥\f + \fr 36:22 \ft Literally “hands” \f* for the one frame\f + \fr 36:22 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f* \add for\add* joining ⸤one to another⸥\f + \fr 36:22 \ft Literally “one to one” \f* \add and\add* likewise for all the frames\f + \fr 36:22 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* of the tabernacle.

And he made the frames\f + \fr 36:23 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* for the tabernacle \add with\add* twenty frames\f + \fr 36:23 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* for the south\f + \fr 36:23 \ft Or “southward southward” \f* side.

And he made forty silver bases under the twenty frames,\f + \fr 36:24 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* \add with\add* two bases under the one frame\f + \fr 36:24 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f* for its two ⸤pegs⸥\f + \fr 36:24 \ft Literally “hands” \f* and two bases under the ⸤next⸥\f + \fr 36:24 \ft Literally “one” \f* frame\f + \fr 36:24 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f* for its two ⸤pegs⸥.\f + \fr 36:24 \ft Literally “hands” \f*
And for the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, he made twenty frames\f + \fr 36:25 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f*

and their forty silver bases, \add with\add* two bases under the one frame\f + \fr 36:26 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f* and two bases under the ⸤next⸥\f + \fr 36:26 \ft Literally “one” \f* frame.\f + \fr 36:26 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f*

And for the rear of the tabernacle ⸤on the west⸥\f + \fr 36:27 \ft Or “westward,” literally “seaward,” toward the Mediterranean Sea \f* he made six frames.\f + \fr 36:27 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f*
And he made two frames\f + \fr 36:28 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* for the tabernacle corners at the rear.
And they were double at the bottom, and they were completely together on its top to the one ring; he did likewise for the two of them, for the two corners.
And there were eight frames\f + \fr 36:30 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* and their sixteen silver bases, two bases, two bases under the one frame.\f + \fr 36:30 \ft Or “board” or “plank” \f*
And he made five bars of acacia wood for the frames\f + \fr 36:31 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* on the one side of the tabernacle,

and five bars for the frames\f + \fr 36:32 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* on the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames\f + \fr 36:32 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* at the rear ⸤on the west⸥.\f + \fr 36:32 \ft Or “westward,” literally “seaward,” toward the Mediterranean Sea \f*
And he made the middle bar to run in the midst of the frames\f + \fr 36:33 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* from end to end.

And he overlaid the frames\f + \fr 36:34 \ft Or “boards” or “planks” \f* with gold, and he made their rings of gold \add as\add* ⸤holders⸥\f + \fr 36:34 \ft Literally “houses” \f* for the bars, and he overlaid the bars with gold.
And he made the curtain of blue and purple and crimson \add yarns\add* and finely twisted linen, \add the\add* work of a craftsman; he made it \add with\add* cherubim.
And he made for it four acacia pillars, and he overlaid them with gold, \add with\add* their gold hooks, and he cast for them four silver bases.
And he made for the entrance of the tent a screen of blue and purple and crimson \add yarns\add* and finely twisted linen, \add the\add* work of an embroiderer,
and the five pillars and their hooks, and he overlaid their tops and their connections \add with\add* gold, and their five bases \add were\add* bronze.
